definition[0]: to develop something such as a plan or a set of rules, and decide all the details of how it will be done
example[0]: He formulated Labour Party education policy in 1922.
example[1]: Darwin formulated the theory of natural selection.
definition[1]: to think carefully about what to say, and say it clearly
example[2]: We are studying the situation but have not formulated any response yet.
definition[2]: to decide on a plan or a way of doing something and work out in detail how it should be done
example[3]: The company has hired a financial adviser to assist in formulating a growth strategy.
example[4]: The company has another 120 days to formulate a plan for repaying its creditors.
